oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interview with Addie Lou Blair Cooper, February 3, 1990 discussing her recollections of the riot in Columbia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Excerpt from an interview with Addie Lou Blair Copper, February 3, 1990 conducted by Gail Williams O'Brien as part of her research for the book _The Color of the Law: Race, Violence, and Justice in the Post World War II South_. In the clip, Blair-Cooper discusses her memories of the day of the incident in the radio repair shop.
Addie Lou Blair Cooper is African American resident of Columbia who present in Columbia during the riot and the trial.
